description:
An intensive introductory laboratory course in organismal biology. 

BIOL 124 is the companion course to BIOL 121 and may be taken before or after BIOL 121. Students may not take both BIOL 102 and 124 for credit. 

Lab fee $150.
name: INTRO ORGANISM BIOL. LAB

values.comments:
This course is the laboratory companion course for BIO 121, and is described in the course registrar as “an intensive introductory laboratory course in organismal biology.” It can be taken either before or after BIO 121.

Students’ opinions about the course content were inconsistent. Many were enthusiastic, claiming the course is “very good…for a wide range of biology topics” and “engaging.” Others, however, felt that the “content is a little dry.”

Students had mixed feelings regarding Professor Robinson as well. One student noted that meeting with the professor one-on-one several times during the semester was extremely helpful. Others commented that they felt that the lectures were not particularly beneficial to the course as a whole, since the only graded evaluations were quizzes during lecture and the final practical exam.

Many students complained that the course was only offered for .5 credits, since they felt that the workload warranted a full credit. Students provided mixed feedback as to whether or not the course was better suited for pre-med students or Bio majors.
